Игра ещё с середины 00-х стала хорошей после первой части. Гейплей, противники, композиция отличные и по сей день. Новые солдаты, монстры, оружия в ней хорошо запоминаются, особенно солдаты) После них я  стал представлять всех полицейских и военных такимим как ХЛ2.
Только меня почему-то сейчас (2017) игра переключает на рабочий стол. Может это у меня из-за старого ноута (2012).

Half-life 2 is bliss
Böcekler anidn zıplayınca adamı korkutuyo :D

After finally playing the game and finishing it on hard difficulty I have to say the tales are true.

It is indeed an amazing game and I heavily recommend it to anyone thinkin about playing it.

The game combines thoughts from War of Worlds and Orwell's 1984 book ideas and combines them with their own plot of zombies, monsters, aliens, quantum physics and more.

It is an adventure you will not forget anytime soon my friend :)

The right man in the wrong place can make all the difference in the world. -G Man

Half-Life 2 est comme un bon fromage, plus le temps passe, mieux il se savoure. D'une part ses textures, ne prenant à mes yeux aucun coup de vieux, toujours ce charme à moitié post-apocalyptique, l'audio qui est très bien réalisée et surtout les animations, les scènes de dialogues entre NPC.

La campagne est sympathique et très bien travaillé, le temps passé dessus est très appréciable et je recommande carrément ce jeu pour les types cherchant un chef d'oeuvre très bien développé, tout y passe, surtout pour l'année de celui-ci.

En gros, un prix fort abordable pour un classique, des annés qui passent mais un gameplay qui reste jouable, des yeux qui ne sont pas en larmes après des heures passés dessus, bref je vous laisse faire votre achat.
Zajebiste czekam na 3 czesc xD

[h1] Half-Life 2 [/h1]

[b] "Rise and shine, Mr. Freeman. Rise and shine." [/b]

[b] Half-Life 2 [/b] is a game that forever changed my life as a gamer. I was only nine years old when I stumbled across a demo disk copy of [b] The Orange Box [/b] for my Xbox 360, and I decided to check out what that weird little disk had to offer me. I don't remember ever playing an old-school style FPS before that point, and if I had, none of them ever stood out to me the way that [b] Half-Life 2 [/b] did. Little did I know that it would forever change the way I looked at video games, specifically the way a First-Person Shooter could work.

Coming back to it for possibly the tenth time, I was afraid that this game wouldn't hold up the same as it did for me three years ago. Back then, I was worried that it "wouldn't hold up the same as it did four years ago". Both times, I was proven wrong. With an immensely creative direction and timeless characters, [b] Half-Life 2 [/b] still remains one of the greatest FPS titles of all time.

Many fans of the original title criticize this game's lack of revolutionary flavor that the 1998 title was able to bring to the gaming industry. Yes, the sequel brought a fantastic physics engine that changed up the gameplay, but that was already expected to happen with many games in 2004. It was expected that the sequel would continue the great ideas from [b] Half-Life [/b], throwing the great Doctor Gordon Freeman against many types of alien foes with unique designs and powers, but...that didn't really happen. In a lot of ways, [b] Half-Life 2 [/b] was a disappointment in the same way that [b] The Empire Strikes Back [/b] was a disappointment - it shifted the tone of the series in a different direction...

... a much darker direction...

[b] Half-Life 2 [/b] throws you not into a version of Earth with tons of fun aliens to fight. It doesn't throw you into the heat of the aftermath of the Resonance Cascade from the original title. This game tosses you into the remnants of human civilization, desperate to survive mass genocide being committed by an alien empire known as The Combine. There are no more children. There is little hope left...

There is only one "free man".

There really isn't anything to talk about concerning this title that hasn't already been talked about. Many gamers have heard of this title and heard of its legacy, and to describe its refined FPS gameplay and great plot would be like preaching to the choir. What I find more important is to show this game to someone who is newer to FPS games, in hopes that it can be an example of exquisite storytelling and worldbuilding within a video game.

In my opinion, this is Valve's masterpiece, it is their golden child. It is the one game that they are terrified of making a direct sequel for, so much so that it has been sixteen years, nearly three times the gap between [b] Half-Life [/b] and [b] Half-Life 2 [/b], and there is still no sign of [b] Half-Life 3 [/b]. Its been over a decade since this game fell in my lap and proved to me that a fantastic world could be formed within the realms of an FPS title. I, as well as many other people, am eagerly awaiting [b] Half-Life 3 [/b]. Expectations are all over the place for that title, and there's a very good reason for that. 

Its hard to follow up a near perfect video game. Valve would be putting its reputation on the line to deliver something revolutionary for fans. However, there are rumblings that many employees want to return to this world and finish Gordon Freeman's story. Whether it is a traditional FPS or it involves virtual reality technology, there's only one thing for certain - the only thing standing between [b] Half-Life 3 [/b] and the end of the trilogy is...time.

Of course I [b] Recommend [/b] this game.

Its one for the ages.

[h2] Final Verdict: 10/10 (Masterpiece) [/h2]

If you enjoyed this review, feel free to check out my curator page for my thoughts on a variety of other games!

Bir kızla tanıştım, yolculuğumun sonuna kadar bana eşlik eden, bir kızla tanıştım, silahı eline yakıştıran, bir kızla tanıştım, bir bakışıyla korkusunu anlatan, ama bir kız gördüm, galiba bunca yıllık yalnızlığıma ilaç olan...

Onun adı: 
                "ALYX"

Macera dolu yolculuğumun başlarında tanıştığım, beni çapulcuların elinden kurtaracak kadar cesur ve güçlü olan bu kadın, beni benden almayı başardı. Daha ilk karşılaşmamızda bana sergilediği tutum ve maceranın ilerleyen kısımların da bana olan hislerinin derinleşmesi ve benim ona zaten çoktan vurulmuş olmam, hikayenin nasıl geliştiğini anlatır nitelikte...

Birlikte ölümden döndük, birlikte yolculuk ettik, birlikte savaştık, birlikte sinirlendik, birlikte üzüldük, birlikte ihanete uğradık, ama ortak olan tek bir şey vardı...

*HEP, BİRLİKTEYDİK*

Umarım bir gün buraya "Olduk beyler" yazma şansını yakalarım.

Hoşçakalın...

Un increible juego que no te deja indiferente. Tiene 13 años y es como el vino. En serio, brutal lo bien que envejece. Es una total innovacion, que se ambienta en un cínico realismo, es un puzzle que hay que resolver solos. La trama utiliza todos los elementos para transmitir, no hay nada que olvidar. Los scripts no te invaden, a no ser que el juego no quiera que te pierdas algo, pero te trata como un adulto. Creo que es perfecto.

A día de hoy, mi juego favorito detrás de Ocarina of time.

the real reasoning behind HL3 not coming out is probably a really deep rabbit hole conspiracy. the game would sell amazingly well, its extremely high in demand, HL2 ended with a cliff hanger, its just. yea. theres a lot of deep shit in this games lore to begin with. things that parallel to our word, the concept of zero point energy technology, an overbearing controlling government, its a great piece of work that indeed contains a lot of hidden meaning from the very start to finish, even what random citizens say as you wander around the environment.

even from a gameplay standpoint, 13 years later, this game stands true to being a masterpiece, even graphically it is great. it makes it seem like when this game was made that was the pinnacle of gaming, obviously theres tons of better games with better graphics that have come out ever since, but half life 2 struck a perfect balance. its like how some people point out that we ceased to invent new technology since the 60s or 70s or so, all we're doing is making the technology we already have better. a lot of the "new" things that have come out in the past decade, and will come out in the next decade was actually discovered in the mid to late 20th century but remained top secret until a way is found for it to become public. HD TVs? created decades ago but remained top secret until they finally released it to the public as a consumer product. same thing with almost anything else. gaming has nothing technically new, only things improved upon and made better. but even VR is nothing new, has been a concept for over a century, and during the 50s to 70s the sensorama was a thing. a surprising amount of technology today can be traced back to the 50s. new technology that will come out in the next 4-10 years will have been traced back to the 50s from some top secret project or psyop.

Böyle bi oyunun 2004te çıktığına hala inanamıyorum.Half life her zaman diğer oyunlara öncü olmuş yenilikçi bir oyun. Beğenmemek elde değil.

Ce jeu est un super RPG qui pour un jeu de 2004 est très bien réalisé, je vous le conseil fortement mais ce jeu à quand même ses inconvénients. Les graphiques sont très beau je trouve mais le sujet du jeu est un peu bizarre. Le truc c'est que dans ce jeu il faut beaucoup réfléchir car des fois pour trouver la solution il faut être juticieux car la solution peut se trouver juste à côté de vous sans même vous en aperçoir ( enfin moi je me suis fais avoir comme ça mais peut-être juste que c'est moi qui suis bête ). Enfin bref les dialogues que les personnages dissent ils faut bien les écouter. Le jeu est juste incroyable et surtout acheter le pour son prix très peu chère.Achetez-le^^

Half-Life isn't just a game. Half-Life is a whole universe of adventures and secrets. IMHO, you can not go through this remaining indifferent.

I think every gamer should get acquainted with this game in order to know for themselves what is a [b]masterpiece[/b]. 
So take a crowbar and go for it!!

Half-Life 3.

Much more refined gameplay-wise, visually, and in terms of the integrity of the code as far as not being full of awful bugs. I didn't experience a single bug in my playthrough. Unlike the first game, this game feels balanced around the hard difficulty setting, so I would advise everyone to try it out. This one also offers the ability to switch difficulty at any point, which is not a mechanic I am a fan of, but new players can switch away from hard if they find it too difficult. The only thing I dislike about this game is that the player sort of takes a backseat to other characters. The best levels all involve the player in a puzzle-filled, semi-open environment with encounters placed throughout intelligently, and the worst all gate the player's progress through npcs. The levels with npcs tend to have, as one would expect, npc-friendly level design. I feel that these sections are less true to the core of what makes these games so good.

Half Life serisini çok önceki yıllardan beri biliriz. Half Life 2 için gerek oyun süresi olarak gerekse oynabilirlik, oyundan alacağınız keyif olarak baktığımızda çok iyi durumda olduğunu görebiliriz. İlk aldığımda her ne kadar biraz ön yargı ile aldıysamda oynamaya başladıktan sonra oyunun oynanması gereken bir klasik olduğunun hemen farkında varıyorsunuz. Son olarak Valve bu oyunda Source oyun motoru kullandığından oyunun çok iyi performans verdiğini söyleyebilirim...

Zum 500. Review ein Klassiker:

"Half-Life 2" ist ein First-Person-Shooter mit Physik-Engine und ein Meilenstein der Spielegeschichte aus dem Jahre 2004.

Wieder starten wir als Gordon Freeman in einer Bahn, die uns in die City17 führt. Eine Art Gefangenelager. Denn die Außerirdischen haben die Erde eingenommen. Was ist mit Black Mesa und was ist mit den Wissenschaftlern? Und schon beginnt eine wilde, lineare Höllenfahrt durch überraschende Welten und erstaunliche Situationen. Die Story gilt es, selbst zu erleben.

Die Mechaniken funktionieren dabei fast alle erstaunlich intuitiv, prompt und flüssig. Ob Gunplay oder Movement, alles ist gut aufeinander abgestimmt und geht leicht von der Hand. Das muß es auch, denn gegen Ende zieht der Schwierigkeitsgrad, der seicht beginnt, nochmal deutlich an.

Erstaunlich ist auch die Vielfältigkeit der Möglichkeiten der Vorgehensweise bei der Gegnerneutralisierung. Klassische Waffen stehen uns ebenso wie außerirdische zur Verfügung. Wenn wir insektenartiges Getier zu Gesicht bekommen, können wir aber zum Beispiel auch Pheromonkugeln auf humanoide Gegner werfen und so die Insektenartigen auf letztere hetzen und dadurch gleich zwei Gegnertypen loswerden.

Nach einiger Zeit erhalten wir eines der Herzstücke der Spielmechanik: die vielgerühmte Gravity-Gun. Damit können wir herumliegende Dinge, Kisten, Fässer oder auch Kreissägeblätter aufnehmen und gegen Gegner schleudern. Sehr effektiv uns spaßig. Zudem ist sie auch für die Lösung diverser Rätsel sehr hilfreich.

Erstaunlich ist, auch heute noch, das Pacing und die Variationstiefe. Normale Shooterpassagen wechseln sich ab mit meist physiklastigen Rätseln. Fahrpassagen, in denen wir gegnerischen Bomben ausweichen, wechseln sich ab mit akrobatischem Schleichen auf schmalen Eisenträgern in luftiger Höhe. Schauplatzwechsel sind an der Tagesordnung. Und alles wird zusammengehalten durch intelligente Zwischensequenzen mit interessanten Charakteren.

Sicher ein Highlight: unser uns leider nicht zu lang begleitender, intelligent agierender Roboterhund, genannt "Dog", dessen Animationen noch heute zu beeindrucken wissen.

Die Grafik ist für das Jahr 2004 herausragend und auch heute noch hochatmosphärisch. Die weitläufigen Landschaften sind toll gestaltet und gekonnt ausgeleuchtet. Vor allem die Tiefenwirkung kann noch heute beeindrucken.

Ebenso meisterhaft der famose Soundtrack, der treibend intelligent die Stimmung des Spieles trifft und es dadurch noch vielschichtiger, noch mehrdimensionaler und noch fühlbarer macht. Das ist höchste kompositorische Computersoundqualität

Kleine Kritikpunkte gibt es sicher auch. So ist die KI der Verbündeten, die aber nicht lange vorkommt, nicht immer hilfreich. Oft stellen sich Kollegen fröhlich ins Schußfeld oder versperren gar eine Tür. Auch die deutsche Synchro ist einige Stufen schwächer als das englische Original ausgefallen. Auch die Kontrollierbarkeit der Fahrzeuge könnte direkter sein.

Aber die kaum vorhandenen Schwächen werden durch das Gesamtpaket und die herausragende Atmosphäre schneller überdeckt, als man Freeman sagen kann.

"Half-Life 2" schafft etwas, was auch heute selten erreicht wird und nur wenige Shooter-Titel wie etwa "Bioshock" oder "Fallout 3" geschafft haben: es macht eine eigene Welt auf, die komplex und in sich geschlossen scheint und dadurch zu dem wird, was Immersion erzeugt: wahr.  

[h1]Wertung:[/h1]
10/10 Atmosphäre
10/10 Story
9/10 Grafik
9/10 Sound
9/10 Spielmechanik
9/10 Balancing
10/10 Spielspass
(Wertungen von Klassikern beziehen immer die technischen Möglichkeiten der Zeit mit ein)

[h1]Fazit:[/h1]
Meisterwerk & Meilenstein.

[h1][b]10/10 Gesamtwertung
Get your ass up there and buy this.
